claim: Flublok (quadrivalent) was evaluated in the pivotal trial against Fluarix (quadrivalent standard-dose vaccine).

verified_evidence.quote: Study 6 (NCT02285998) enrolled subjects 50 years of age and older, randomized to receive Flublok Quadrivalent or Comparator (Fluarix Quadrivalent, manufactured by GlaxoSmithKline) as an active control [see Clinical Studies (14)]. The safety analysis population included 4328 Flublok Quadrivalent recipients and 4344 Comparator vaccine recipients.
verified_evidence.explanation: The quote directly supports the claim. It explicitly states that Flublok Quadrivalent was evaluated in Study 6, where subjects were randomized to receive either Flublok Quadrivalent or Fluarix Quadrivalent (a standard-dose quadrivalent vaccine) as the active control. This confirms that the pivotal trial compared Flublok Quadrivalent against Fluarix Quadrivalent, as the claim asserts.
verified_evidence.presence_explanation: The quote appears on page 3 of the document, with only minor formatting and spelling differences due to OCR or extraction. The document states: 'Study 6 (NCT02285998) enrolled subjects 50 years of age and older, randomized to receive Flublok Quadrivalent or Comparator (Fluarix Quadrivalent, manufactured by GlaxoSmithKline) as an active control [see Clinical Studies (14)]. The safety analysis population included 4328 Flublok Quadrivalent recipients and 4344 Comparator vaccine recipients.' This matches the quoted content in all relevant facts, numbers, and technical details.
verified_evidence.support_explanation: The quote directly supports the claim. verified_evidence.original_relevance: This quote explicitly states that Flublok Quadrivalent was evaluated in a trial (Study 6) where it was directly compared against Fluarix Quadrivalent, confirming that the pivotal trial used Fluarix Quadrivalent as the comparator.

verified_evidence.quote: The primary efficacy endpoint of Study 6 was rtPCR-positive, protocol defined ILI due to any strain of influenza. Attack rates and relative vaccine efficacy (rVE), defined as 1 - [Attack rate Flublok Quadrivalent / Attack Rate Comparator], were calculated for the total efficacy population (n=8604) for the primary efficacy endpoint and for several alternative efficacy endpoints (Table 5). ... Comparator=U.S.-licensed quadrivalent inactivated influenza vaccine, Fluarix Quadrivalent, manufactured by GlaxoSmithKline;
verified_evidence.explanation: The quote directly supports the claim. It explicitly states that Study 6 (the pivotal trial) evaluated Flublok Quadrivalent against Fluarix Quadrivalent (a standard-dose quadrivalent vaccine), and describes the efficacy comparison between the two. This matches the claim that Flublok (quadrivalent) was evaluated in the pivotal trial against Fluarix (quadrivalent standard-dose vaccine).

The text states: 'The primary efficacy endpoint of Study 6 was rtPCR-positive, protocol defined ILI due to any strain of influenza. Attack rates and relative vaccine efficacy (rVE), defined as 1 [Attack rate Flublok Quadrivalent / Attack Rate Comparator], were calculated for the total efficacy population (n=8604) for the primary efficacy endpoint and for several alternative efficacy endpoints (Table 5).' It also specifies: 'Comparator=U.S.-licensed quadrivalent inactivated influenza vaccine, Fluarix Quadrivalent, manufactured by GlaxoSmithKline;'. The factual content, including the study number, endpoints, comparator, and vaccine names, is preserved and matches the quote to verify.
